column1: In the heartland of #Kansas @USDA_NBAF will play a key role in preventing and combating diseases threatening human health like #COVID19. I'm proud Kansas places a high priority on proactively preparing for devastating animal disease outbreaks. https://t.co/Qcmaf5YA20

Good news for #Kansas: @Pfizer teamed up with @GileadSciences to manufacture and supply Gilead’s investigational antiviral remdesivir for #COVID19 treatment. Manufacturing will happen in McPherson Kansas. https://t.co/iBSaNBCxTz

The Clinical Reference Laboratory from Lenexa KS has received FDA Emergency Use Authorization on their at home saliva-based COVID-19 tests. Read more below about this great news that will make testing for the coronavirus much easier: https://t.co/xRsdabwVBb

I recently spoke with @WFPChief Beasley about the international assistance needs exacerbated by #COVID19 and the importance of our #FarmBill global assistance programs in helping to respond. https://t.co/u7xlEE21TN

.@KState is doing their part in the fight against coronavirus by obtaining a research agreement that will utilize a new platform to research and develop a vaccine at Pat Roberts Hall the university’s Biosecurity Research Institute. Read more here: https://t.co/bapPNOfI4l
Thanks ⁦@SecretarySonny for today’s update⁩ on ⁦@USDA⁩’s #COVID19 response including CFAP and nutrition issues. https://t.co/jqiCvm1xh1

YRC Worldwide Inc. is critical to not only #Kansas but to the entire country as a whole. I appreciate @stevenmnuchin1 for recognizing this need in the heartland and I will continue to advocate for the workers and families affected by #COVID19 throughout our great state. https://t.co/uqriqnqKLb

Last night the U.S. Senate unanimously passed an extension of the #PaycheckProtectionProgram that many Americans have benefitted from in the wake of #COVID19.   Now it is the House’s turn. https://t.co/Faryz2VZmM
.@HHSGov announced today that @KDHE will receive $2 million for hospital preparedness. This is great news for #Kansas as we continue to battle COVID-19.

During the @GOPHELP hearing today I discussed how our nation can prepare for future threats posed by zoonotic diseases that transfer from animals to humans like the coronavirus. Learn more here: https://t.co/NN4XGIpHWU
Great news today! @HHSGov announced $3.6 million for hospital support and preparedness in light of COVID-19 for @kansashospitals @KDHE and the Iowa Tribe of Kansas and Nebraska.

Now more than ever it’s imperative we make the PPP loan forgiveness process as simple and effective as possible for our small businesses that are finally beginning to reopen following lengthy shutdowns due to the coronavirus pandemic. Read more here: https://t.co/Jdz31hbFVR
“Shop Kansas Farms helps make connections.” Read about the Facebook group that is connecting consumers to farmers and ranchers during COVID-19: https://t.co/ISEOpQVh7J

.@KState is showing what being a Wildcat truly means in light of the coronavirus pandemic. Starting at the end of the month the department of grain science and industry will donate flour produced at the Hal Ross Flour Mill to those in need.   https://t.co/Xd8vshDqhj
ICYMI: I participated in a virtual town hall last week along with the entire Kansas delegation to discuss the impacts of COVID-19 in our state. https://t.co/sk2ZKgMly5

Great news today for skilled nursing facilities throughout Kansas! @HHSGov has announced $63 million in funding to help support these crucial facilities as they combat the impacts of coronavirus. https://t.co/13C0IFbhb4

Looking forward to joining @JerryMoran @RepRonEstes @Rep_Watkins @RepDavids and @RepMarshall for a coronavirus town hall  moderated by @JohnHoltNews. You can watch live on @fox4kc @KSNTNews or @KSNNews https://t.co/ej3iNVNsND

This pandemic has shown now more than ever how critical the heroic work of our rural first responders truly is which is why @SenatorDurbin and I are pushing for more funding for the SIREN Act in the next coronavirus relief package.

Not only is this news beneficial to our state with the creation of 300 new jobs but it is crucial to our country. The VTM tubes being produced at these facilities in Kansas will be transported nationwide to increase testing for the coronavirus.
The mass production of these VTM tubes that are utilized for the transport of COVID-19 test samples requires an additional 300 employees to be hired at the new site.
During the @GOPHELP hearing today I discussed the COVID-19 testing needs at meatpacking plants in Kansas. Learn more here: https://t.co/G1dsE2fdp4

49 years after Dennis Ruhnke had to leave school @GovLauraKelly and @KState President Richard Myers presented Dennis with a bachelor’s degree in agriculture in recognition of his selflessness during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Don’t miss McConnell Air Force Base honoring the Kansans on the front lines of the coronavirus in one hour! https://t.co/Dnieh4LXlf

Join me in wishing the teachers across Kansas and the country a #HappyTeachersDay today. COVID-19 has reminded us how important the teachers in our communities are we appreciate and thank each of you. https://t.co/XPwdhQ24vf

After helping the @Chiefs win the Super Bowl just two months ago @LaurentDTardif is making #ChiefsKingdom proud once again by serving on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic with his doctorate in medicine. Read more here: https://t.co/XBk55YBaMR
Discussed the impact the coronavirus pandemic is having on our health care systems with the President and CEO of @StormontVail Dr. Robert Kenagy.

Spoke with the @KansasDeptofAg about the impact COVID-19 is having on the agriculture community and how the CARES Act works to help the ag industry across our state and the country during this challenging time.

I spoke with @SeemaCMS about the issues COVID-19 has caused for Kansas statewide. We discussed the great work @ChildrensMercy and @KUMedCenter are doing and the importance of assisting children’s hospitals and academic medical centers during this pandemic.
Today @HHSGov announced Kansas will receive $8.5 million in grants to combat the coronavirus in rural areas. Read more here: https://t.co/YpfFtJiIMd https://t.co/UihYAFJ6uT
I’m honored to be selected by @realDonaldTrump to serve on the Opening Up America Again Congressional Group and represent the needs of Kansans in response to the coronavirus. https://t.co/0cJnxTsCK8

With the coronavirus slowing air travel across the nation our state has felt its impact at our airports. Regardless of size all of the airports throughout Kansas are in need of crucial assistance at a time like this.
The Employee Retention Credit is available to businesses impacted by coronavirus. Read more: https://t.co/0YLoyiK0SJ
This first distribution from @HHSgov is crucial to the providers throughout our state who are on the frontlines fighting the coronavirus pandemic. Find more information here: https://t.co/OGf8rXaaqQ
Tune in soon to hear us discuss COVID-19 and it’s impact on Kansas. https://t.co/IJlzXU0qRL
Spoke with Sam Huenergardt the CEO of @AdventHealth Shawnee Mission today regarding their efforts to combat the coronavirus and provide care during this time.
Do you have questions or need clarification regarding COVID-19? Visit my website here for the latest information: https://t.co/QpJi9DguYf
“Health centers in Kansas and Missouri approved for millions in federal coronavirus aid.” Read more about this great news for Kansans from the @KCStar. https://t.co/biY8m9J2gW
Spoke with Treasury Secretary @stevenmnuchin1 regarding the government’s response to the novel coronavirus.
.@HHSGov announced Kansas will receive $15385520 in funding designated by the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security (CARES) Act for Community Health Centers across the state.
I appreciated the opportunity to hear from @stevenmnuchin1 and Dr. Anthony Fauci today and receive an update on their continued efforts to combat the coronavirus.
The IRS is urging taxpayers to be extra cautious of email phishing and scamming attempts as a result of COVID-19. Learn more about precautionary measures here: https://t.co/K0m5CoQ8kp

Working with our local governments is crucial as our state deals with the impacts of the coronavirus. Today I spoke with members of the @LeagueKSMunis to provide a federal update and hear their concerns. We will get through this together.

I thank the @ksdehq for identifying a need and solution and the @USDA Food and Nutrition Service for reducing barriers to feed more hungry schoolchildren. Read more on child nutrition programs changes in Kansas during COVID-19: https://t.co/0YnKusleHk
.@realDonaldTrump approved the Kansas disaster declaration to provide recovery efforts in the areas impacted by COVID-19. Learn more here: https://t.co/JcFR2eWlG3

As our nation endures a public health emergency some of the new coronavirus laws provide more funding for senior nutrition programs. @HHSGov has started to release $250 million in grants from the Administration for Community Living to help provide meals during this dire time.

The coronavirus continues to take its toll on the nation and the world and I am proud we finally came together for the good of the country with this bill that delivers necessary assistance to our workers businesses and families.

During a pandemic like COVID-19 it is critical to remember rural Kansans and Americans and how healthcare is provided to them. Learn more on how telehealth is being used to combat the coronavirus here: https://t.co/utuNJBtiA4

The coronavirus pandemic is unlike anything we’ve seen in the last 100 years. Read more about how crucial the new National Bio and Agro-Defense facility in Manhattan will be in researching zoonotic diseases like this virus: https://t.co/AlvbpVDYEH

.@DHSgov stressed today the importance of researching COVID-19. The National Bio and Agro-Defense facility in Manhattan KS will be operational in 2022 and will help fill this void of dealing with zoonotic diseases like the novel coronavirus. https://t.co/RBKUwFpWb9
ICYMI: I joined Speaker @RonRyckman’s telephone town hall tonight to address coronavirus concerns. Read my full remarks here: https://t.co/DIRaRljh38

It is time we put partisanship aside and pass the Coronavirus Aid Relief and Economic Security Act. I took to the Senate floor today to urge my colleagues to do right by the American people. Watch here: https://t.co/DkQ7XdfWwV

Allowing patients to use their health savings account funds to purchase over-the-counter medications without getting permission from their doctors will help improve social distancing to combat the coronavirus.

I’m pleased the Coronavirus Phase 3 package includes both my Priority Zoonotic Animal Drug designation along with the Restoring Access to Medication Act of 2019 my bill to ease the purchase of over-the-counter medications using health savings accounts.
Kansas small businesses cooperatives and nonprofits suffering substantial economic injury due to COVID-19 can now apply for low interest @SBAgov federal disaster loans at https://t.co/508ym1be8B

Tonight I had a productive call with @JerryMoran and members of the @KansasChamber. We discussed the novel Coronavirus and legislation to help small businesses during this difficult time. Read more: https://t.co/AAmxY0ohsE

Now that the Senate has passed the Families First Coronavirus Response Act I urge @realDonaldTrump to sign this critical piece of legislation so that we can provide much needed relief throughout our country. https://t.co/COV6vUgmte https://t.co/svMlYwPX9N

Today @USTreasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin announced the federal tax deadline is extended 90 days. This allows taxpayers an extra 3 months to pay their income taxes as a response to coronavirus. Learn more here: https://t.co/usipeYDtI1

I am remaining in Washington to vote on legislation that is important to the country and I will be here to do my job which is my obligation to Kansans.   Further information on the novel coronavirus and office procedure can be found here: https://t.co/QpJi9DguYf

The novel coronavirus cannot be taken lightly. I have asked my staff to follow all procedures to ensure everyone’s safety but our plans will still allow us to respond to constituent casework needs and legislative questions. We will do everything we can to help #FlattenTheCurve.
Today I announced my staff in DC and Kansas will be teleworking to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. My office will still provide constituent services to Kansans during this time.

Tonight @GovLauraKelly declared a state of emergency following the first novel Coronavirus death in Kansas. I will work with the state of Kansas to assist with any help needed from the federal government.

Today the Senate approved funding to fight the novel coronavirus with overwhelming bipartisan support. I am pleased we were able to put partisan politics aside and work together to quickly send a crucial first step in battling this virus to @realDonaldTrump's desk.

I gained crucial insight during the @GOPHELP Committee hearing today regarding terminology used by @CDCgov to describe the novel coronavirus. We must clarify that the term ‘community spread’ is meant to categorize the source of a case and not indicate a continued mass spread.
